title: Guest Post — AI Isn’t Going to Pay for Content … Part Two: The Path Forward
content: Today’s post paves a clear path forward in making AI work for publishers in the brave new agentic world. The post Guest Post — AI Isn’t Going to Pay for Content … Part Two: The Path Forward appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .

title: Preliminary Evidence Linking Open Science to Research Integrity
content: Is open scholarship an honest signal of researcher integrity? We present preliminary evidence that data and code sharing, preprinting, and other open behaviors are indeed less common in papermill articles. The post Preliminary Evidence Linking Open Science to Research Integrity appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
creator: Tim Vines, Ben Kaube, Adam Day, Kristen Ratan
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Why Authors Aren’t Disclosing AI Use and What Publishers Should (Not) Do About It
content: Only a negligible percentage of authors seem to actually be disclosing their AI use. Here's why I think that's the case. The post Why Authors Aren’t Disclosing AI Use and What Publishers Should (Not) Do About It appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
creator: Avi Staiman
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Mental Health Awareness Mondays — The Courage to Be Uncertain: A New Approach to Impostor Feelings
content: Today's guest bloggers reflect on the experience of "imposter syndrome" and how we might adopt a new approach to moments of uncertainty and change. title: Guest Post — The Ghost in the Machine: Why Generative AI is a Crisis of Authorship, Not Just a Tool
content: Today's guest author raises the question of whether a researcher submitting an article that was significantly drafted by an LLM without clear disclosure is effectively engaging in a contemporary form of ghost authorship. The post Guest Post — The Ghost in the Machine: Why Generative AI is a Crisis of Authorship, Not Just a Tool appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
creator: Ch. Mahmood Anwar
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Guest Post — AI Isn’t Going to Pay for Content … At Least Not How You’re Hoping It Will
content: Today's guest post is the first in a two-part series — we begin by facing up to the fact that AI will not become the content windfall the way many in the publishing industry hope. The post Guest Post — AI Isn’t Going to Pay for Content … At Least Not How You’re Hoping It Will appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .

title: Creating a Culture of Diversity and Inclusion Revisited: An Interview with Vicky Williams of Emerald Publishing
content: In this follow-up to a 2018 interview, Alice Meadows revisits the topic of DEIA with Emerald Publishing's CEO, Vicky Williams to find out what progress has been made and where improvements are still needed -- both at Emerald and within scholarly communications The post Creating a Culture of Diversity and Inclusion Revisited: An Interview with Vicky Williams of Emerald Publishing appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .

title: Guest Post — Open Scholarship is Poised to Create More Value than Ever, but Are We Ready?
content: Today's guest blogger observes how advances in technology create unprecedented opportunities in open scholarship, and asks: Can incentive structures keep up? title: Open Access Policies – The Devil’s in the Details

title: Guest Post — What is The ‘Right’ Way to Make Tea? Why International Marketing Needs a Local Touch
